solution_line_template: Marta bought five textbooks on sale, for a total of {num_sale_textbooks} * {cost_per_sale_textbook} = $<<{num_sale_textbooks}*{cost_per_sale_textbook}={total_sale_cost}>>{total_sale_cost}.
Three textbooks from the bookstore had a cost of {num_bookstore_textbooks} * {cost_online_books} = $<<{num_bookstore_textbooks}*{cost_online_books}={total_bookstore_cost}>>{total_bookstore_cost}.

That means that Marta spent in total {total_sale_cost} + {cost_online_books} + {total_bookstore_cost} = $<<{total_sale_cost}+{cost_online_books}+{total_bookstore_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} on textbooks.
